Act Title: THE SALARY, ALLOWANCES AND PENSION OF MEMBERS OF PARLIAMENT ACT, 1954

Act Definition.0: An Act to provide for the 1[salary, allowances and pension] of Members of Parliament.

paragraphs.0: (1) This Act may be called the 2[Salary, Allowances and Pension] of Members of Parliament Act, 1954.
paragraphs.1: (2) It shall come into force on the first day of June, 1954.

paragraphs.0: Without prejudice to the other provisions of this Act, where during any part of a year the usual place of residence of a member in his constituency is inaccessible to or from any place outside his constituency by road. rail or steamer due to climatic conditions, but there is air service between any place in his constituency, and the nearest place, having rail service, outside his constituency, such member shall be entitled to travel to and from by air from the nearest place in his constituency where there is air service to such place having rail service:

(1) On the death of a member of either House of Parliament during his term of office, his spouse, if any, or dependent of such member shall be paid during the remaining period of life of such spouse or, as the case may be, such dependent so long as such dependent continues to be a dependent within the meaning of clause (aa) of section 2, family pension equivalent to one-half of the pension which such member of Parliament would have received had he retired:
paragraphs.1: Provided that no such family pension shall be payable to a dependent if such dependent is a sitting member of Parliament or is drawing pension under section 8A.
paragraphs.2: (2) The family pension payable under sub-section (1) shall also be payable to the spouse or dependent of a person who was a member of either House of Parliament or the Provisional Parliament at any time 1*** and died after serving as such member:
paragraphs.3: Provided that such spouse or dependent is not drawing any pension under this Act or is not entitled to draw family pension under the proviso to sub-section (1):
paragraphs.4: Provided further that no person shall be entitled to claim arrears of any family pension under this sub-section in respect of a period before the commencement of the Salary, Allowances and Pension of Members of Parliament (Amendment) Act, 2006 (40 of 2006).
paragraphs.5: Explanation.― For the purposes of this section, “Provisional Parliament” shall include the body which functioned as the Constituent Assembly of the Dominion of India immediately before the commencement of the Constitution.]

(1) For the purpose of making rules under this section, there shall be constituted a Joint Committee of both Houses of Parliament consisting of five members from the Council of States nominated by the Chairman and ten members from the House of the People nominated by the Speaker.
paragraphs.1: (2) The Joint Committee constituted under sub-section (1) shall elect its Chairman and shall have power to regulate its procedure.
paragraphs.2: 4[(2A) A member of the Joint Committee shall hold office as such member for one year from the date of his nomination and any casual vacancy in the Joint Committee may be filled by nomination by the Chairman of the Council of States or the Speaker of the House of the People, as the case may be.
paragraphs.3: Explanation.― In the case of a member of a Joint Committee holding office as such immediately before the commencement of the Salaries and Allowances of Members of Parliament (Amendment) Act, 1958 (55 of 1958), the period of one year shall be computed from the date of such commencement.]
